ACW

Class Frame

  • java.lang.Object
    • ACW.Frame

  • public class Frame
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that gives you a window for easy game development and quick projects.
    Author:
    Asecave

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DISPOSE_ON_CLOSE
      Closes the window when the close button got pressed.
      static int DO_NOTHING_ON_CLOSE
      The close button gets ignored
      static int EXIT_ON_CLOSE
      Stops the program when the close button gets pressed.
      static int HIDE_ON_CLOSE
      The window hides everywhere but the program of the window goes on.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Frame()
      The normal and only constructor

    • Method Detail

      • setTargetFPS

        public void setTargetFPS(int FPS)
        Sets the frames target that should get displayed in each second.
        Parameters:
        FPS - - The FPS target

      • getTargetFPS

        public int getTargetFPS()
        Returns the frames target that should get displayed in each second.
        Returns:
        an integer of the target FPS value.

      • setTickSpeed

        public void setTickSpeed(int millis)
        Sets the time interval in milliseconds for one tick.
        Parameters:
        millis - - The time interval in milliseconds for one tick.
        See Also:
        More information about ticks: tick()

      • getTickSpeed

        public int getTickSpeed()
        Returns the time interval in milliseconds for one tick.
        Returns:
        an integer value of the interval.
        See Also:
        More information about ticks: tick()

      • getLastFPS

        public float getLastFPS()
        Returns the frames that have been displayed in the last second.
        Returns:
        a float value of the last measured FPS.

      • setDefaultCloseOperation

        public void setDefaultCloseOperation(int operation)
        The action that gets executed when the close button gets pressed.
        Parameters:
        operation - - The operation that should get executed after press. Usable operations are:
        - EXIT_ON_CLOSE
        - DISPOSE_ON_CLOSE
        - DO_NOTHING_ON_CLOSE
        - HIDE_ON_CLOSE

      • setResizable

        public void setResizable(boolean resizable)
        Sets whether the screen can be resized by a mouse cursor.
        Parameters:
        resizable - - If false: The screen is fixed in his size.

      • isResizable

        public boolean isResizable()
        Returns whether the screen can be resized by a mouse cursor.
        Returns:
        A boolean value of the resize state of the window.

      • setFullscreen

        public void setFullscreen(boolean fullscreen)
        Sets whether the window should cover the whole monitor.
        Parameters:
        fullscreen - - True: The window covers the whole monitor.

      • isFullscreen

        public boolean isFullscreen()
        Returns whether the window should cover the whole monitor.
        Returns:
        A boolean value of the screens state.

      • isFocused

        public boolean isFocused()
        Returns whether the window is focused by the mouse cursor. If this window gets clicked by the mouse cursor or if it gets focused by key combinations it gets focused and this method returns True.
        Returns:
        A boolean value of the focus state.

      • getMouseOnWindow

        public java.awt.Point getMouseOnWindow()
        Returns the mouse position on the window. If the mouse exits the window the point stays at the position where the mouse lastly was over the window.
        Returns:
        A Point value with x and y coordinates of the cursor.

      • getFrameWidth

        public int getFrameWidth()
        Returns the width of the outer boarder of the window.
        Returns:
        An integer value of the width

      • setFrameWidth

        public void setFrameWidth(int width)
        Sets the windows outer boarders width.
        Parameters:
        width - - the specific width of the window.

      • getFrameHeight

        public int getFrameHeight()
        Returns the height of the outer boarder of the window.
        Returns:
        An integer value of the height

      • setFrameHeight

        public void setFrameHeight(int height)
        Sets the windows outer boarders height.
        Parameters:
        height - - the specific height of the window.

      • setFrameSize

        public void setFrameSize(int width,
                         int height)
        Sets the windows outer boarders width and height.
        Parameters:
        width - - the specific width of the window.
        height - - the specific height of the window.

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Returns the width of the window without boarder respectively the width of the windows content area.
        Returns:
        An integer with the content area width.

      • setWidth

        public void setWidth(int width)
        sets the width of the window so that the content area width corresponds to the specification.
        Parameters:
        width - - The width of the content area.

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Returns the height of the window without boarder respectively the height of the windows content area.
        Returns:
        An integer with the content area width.

      • setHeight

        public void setHeight(int height)
        sets the height of the window so that the content area height corresponds to the specification.
        Parameters:
        height - - The height of the content area.

      • setSize

        public void setSize(int width,
                    int height)
        sets the width and height of the window so that the content area width and height corresponds to the specifications.
        Parameters:
        width - - The width of the content area.
        height - - The height of the content area.

      • setTitle

        public void setTitle(java.lang.String title)
        Sets the title of the window. The title can be seen at the top bar of the window and in the taskbar if you hover over the windows icon.
        Parameters:
        title - - The title that should get displayed.

      • getTitle

        public java.lang.String getTitle()
        Returns the title of the frame that has been set by the setTitle(String) method.
        Returns:
        A String with the current title.

      • getTitleUpdateRate

        public int getTitleUpdateRate()
        Returns the interval in milliseconds between each title update.
        Returns:
        An integer of the interval
        See Also:
        setTitleUpdateRate(int) to learn more about title updates.

      • setTitleUpdateRate

        public void setTitleUpdateRate(int millis)
        Sets the interval in milliseconds between each title update. The title only gets permanently updated when setShowInfoInTitle(boolean) is set to True.
        Parameters:
        millis - - Specifies the interval between each update.

      • getAdditionalTitle

        public java.lang.String getAdditionalTitle()
        Returns the additional title that has been set by the setAdditionalTitle(String) method.
        Returns:
        A String with the additional title.
        See Also:
        setAdditionalTitle(String) to learn more about additional titles.

      • setAdditionalTitle

        public void setAdditionalTitle(java.lang.String additionalTitle)
        Sets an additional title that gets displayed after the normal title and the info title. It is there to bring more information like the frames per second into the title.
        Parameters:
        additionalTitle - - The additional title String.

      • isShowInfoInTitle

        public boolean isShowInfoInTitle()
        Returns whether more information about this window gets displayed in the title.
        Returns:
        A boolean value of the info title state.
        See Also:
        setShowInfoInTitle(boolean) to see what is getting displayed in the title when the info title is set to True.

      • setShowInfoInTitle

        public void setShowInfoInTitle(boolean showInfoInTitle)
        If this is set to True the title of the window show the following up:
        - FPS (frames per second)
        Parameters:
        showInfoInTitle - Defines whether the information should get displayed.

      • addListener

        public void addListener(Listener listener)
        This method adds a Listener Object from the ACI package. This limits the listener to only listen when the window is focused.
        Parameters:
        listener - - The Listener object.
        See Also:
        Listener, isFocused()

      • titleUpdate

        public void titleUpdate()
        This method gets executed on each title update. The title can be updated by the setTitle(String) method, the setAdditionalTitle(String) method and the setShowInfoInTitle(boolean) method.
        See Also:
        setTitleUpdateRate(int)

      • setup

        public void setup()
        The setup method gets executed only once, at the start of the program, after the frame specifications have been set but before the frameLoop() method gets executed.

      • frameLoop

        public void frameLoop()
        This method gets executed on each frame. This method doesn't get executed the same amount of times in each second. It depends on how fast the computer is the program is running on and how complex the program is. How many times this method got executed in one second can be seen in the getLastFPS() method and gets displayed in the title if setShowInfoInTitle(boolean) is set to True.

      • frameLoop

        public void frameLoop(java.awt.Graphics2D g2d)
        This method gets executed on each frame. This method doesn't get executed the same amount of times in each second. It depends on how fast the computer is the program is running on and how complex the program is. How many times this method got executed in one second can be seen in the getLastFPS() method and gets displayed in the title if setShowInfoInTitle(boolean) is set to True.
        Parameters:
        g2d - - The graphics2D object to draw on the window on each time this method gets executed.

      • tick

        public void tick()
        This method gets executed on each tick. The length of a tick is defined by the setTargetFPS(int) method. Override this method.
